segment.source: description: This article describes how to add playback of adaptive streaming multimedia content to a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
segment.target: description: This article describes how to add playback of adaptive streaming multimedia content to a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

segment.source: This feature currently supports playback of Http Live Streaming (HLS) and Dynamic Streaming over HTTP (DASH) content.
segment.target: This feature currently supports playback of Http Live Streaming (HLS) and Dynamic Streaming over HTTP (DASH) content.

segment.source: title: Adaptive Streaming
segment.target: title: Adaptive Streaming

segment.source: Adaptive Streaming
segment.target: Adaptive Streaming

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: This article describes how to add playback of adaptive streaming multimedia content to a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
segment.target: This article describes how to add playback of adaptive streaming multimedia content to a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

segment.source: This feature currently supports playback of Http Live Streaming (HLS) and Dynamic Streaming over HTTP (DASH) content.
segment.target: This feature currently supports playback of Http Live Streaming (HLS) and Dynamic Streaming over HTTP (DASH) content.

segment.source: Simple adaptive streaming with MediaElement
segment.target: Simple adaptive streaming with MediaElement

segment.source: To display adaptive streaming multimedia in a XAML-based app, add a MediaElement control to your page.
segment.target: To display adaptive streaming multimedia in a XAML-based app, add a MediaElement control to your page.

segment.source: [!code-xmlMediaElementXAML]
segment.target: [!code-xmlMediaElementXAML]

segment.source: Set the Source property of the MediaElement to the URI of a DASH or HLS manifest file.
segment.target: Set the Source property of the MediaElement to the URI of a DASH or HLS manifest file.

segment.source: [!code-csManifestSource]
segment.target: [!code-csManifestSource]

segment.source: Adaptive streaming with AdaptiveMediaSource
segment.target: Adaptive streaming with AdaptiveMediaSource

segment.source: If your app requires more advanced adaptive streaming features, such as providing custom HTTP headers, monitoring the current download and playback bitrates, or adjusting the ratios that determine when the system switches bitrates of the adaptive stream, use the AdaptiveMediaSource object.
segment.target: If your app requires more advanced adaptive streaming features, such as providing custom HTTP headers, monitoring the current download and playback bitrates, or adjusting the ratios that determine when the system switches bitrates of the adaptive stream, use the AdaptiveMediaSource object.

segment.source: The adaptive streaming APIs are found in the Windows.Media.Streaming.Adaptive namespace.
segment.target: The adaptive streaming APIs are found in the Windows.Media.Streaming.Adaptive namespace.

segment.source: [!code-csAdaptiveStreamingUsing]
segment.target: [!code-csAdaptiveStreamingUsing]

segment.source: Initialize the AdaptiveMediaSource with the URI of an adaptive streaming manifest file by calling CreateFromUriAsync.
segment.target: Initialize the AdaptiveMediaSource with the URI of an adaptive streaming manifest file by calling CreateFromUriAsync.

segment.source: The AdaptiveMediaSourceCreationStatus value returned from this method lets you know if the media source was created successfully.
segment.target: The AdaptiveMediaSourceCreationStatus value returned from this method lets you know if the media source was created successfully.

segment.source: If so, you can set the object as the stream source for your MediaElement by calling SetMediaStreamSource.
segment.target: If so, you can set the object as the stream source for your MediaElement by calling SetMediaStreamSource.

segment.source: In this example, the AvailableBitrates property is queried to determine the maximum supported bitrate for this stream, and then that value is set as the inital bitrate.
segment.target: In this example, the AvailableBitrates property is queried to determine the maximum supported bitrate for this stream, and then that value is set as the inital bitrate.

segment.source: This example also registers handlers for the DownloadRequested, DownloadBitrateChanged, and PlaybackBitrateChanged events which are discussed later in this article.
segment.target: This example also registers handlers for the DownloadRequested, DownloadBitrateChanged, and PlaybackBitrateChanged events which are discussed later in this article.

segment.source: [!code-csInitializeAMS]
segment.target: [!code-csInitializeAMS]

segment.source: If you need to set custom HTTP headers for getting the manifest file, you can create an HttpClient object, set the desired headers, and then pass the object into the overload of CreateFromUriAsync.
segment.target: If you need to set custom HTTP headers for getting the manifest file, you can create an HttpClient object, set the desired headers, and then pass the object into the overload of CreateFromUriAsync.

segment.source: [!code-csInitializeAMSWithHttpClient]
segment.target: [!code-csInitializeAMSWithHttpClient]

segment.source: The DownloadRequested event is raised when the system is about to retrieve a resource from the server.
segment.target: The DownloadRequested event is raised when the system is about to retrieve a resource from the server.

segment.source: The AdaptiveMediaSourceDownloadRequestedEventArgs passed into the event handler exposes properties that provide information about the resource being requested such as the type and URI of the resource.
segment.target: The AdaptiveMediaSourceDownloadRequestedEventArgs passed into the event handler exposes properties that provide information about the resource being requested such as the type and URI of the resource.

segment.source: You can use the DownloadRequested event handler to modify the resource request by updating the properties of the AdaptiveMediaSourceDownloadResult object provided by the event args.
segment.target: You can use the DownloadRequested event handler to modify the resource request by updating the properties of the AdaptiveMediaSourceDownloadResult object provided by the event args.

segment.source: In the example below, the URI from which the resource will be retrieved is modified by updating the ResourceUri properties of the result object.
segment.target: In the example below, the URI from which the resource will be retrieved is modified by updating the ResourceUri properties of the result object.

segment.source: You can override the content of the requested resource by setting the Buffer or InputStream properties of the result object.
segment.target: You can override the content of the requested resource by setting the Buffer or InputStream properties of the result object.

segment.source: In the example below, the contents of the manifest resource are replaced by setting the Buffer property.
segment.target: In the example below, the contents of the manifest resource are replaced by setting the Buffer property.

segment.source: Note that if you are updating the resource request with data that is obtained asynchronously, such as retrieving data from a remote server or asynchronous user authentication, you must call AdaptiveMediaSourceDownloadRequestedEventArgs.GetDeferral to get a deferral and then call Complete when the operation is complete to signal the system that the download request operation can continue.
segment.target: Note that if you are updating the resource request with data that is obtained asynchronously, such as retrieving data from a remote server or asynchronous user authentication, you must call AdaptiveMediaSourceDownloadRequestedEventArgs.GetDeferral to get a deferral and then call Complete when the operation is complete to signal the system that the download request operation can continue.

segment.source: [!code-csAMSDownloadRequested]
segment.target: [!code-csAMSDownloadRequested]

segment.source: The AdaptiveMediaSource object provides events that allow you to react when the download or playback bitrates change.
segment.target: The AdaptiveMediaSource object provides events that allow you to react when the download or playback bitrates change.

segment.source: In this example, the current bitrates are simply updated in the UI.
segment.target: In this example, the current bitrates are simply updated in the UI.

segment.source: Note that you can modify the ratios that determine when the system switches bitrates of the adaptive stream.
segment.target: Note that you can modify the ratios that determine when the system switches bitrates of the adaptive stream.

segment.source: For more information, see the AdvancedSettings property.
segment.target: For more information, see the AdvancedSettings property.

segment.source: [!code-csAMSBitrateEvents]
segment.target: [!code-csAMSBitrateEvents]
